[[PageOutline]]
[[Center(begin)]]
= '''CARRA: Copernicus C3S 322 Lot2: Regional Climate Reanalysis for the Arctic '' =

Last modified [[LastModified]]

[[Center(end)]]

The project CARRA aims to produce high resolution regional climate reanalysis for the Arctic. Internally code named as CARRA (Copernicus Arctic Regional Re-Analysis), the project spans between Sept 2017 and Aug 2021 (which has since been adjusted to cover Aug 2017 to Jun 2021 as on June 2019), is coordinated by Met.no, with participation of DMI, SMHI, MF, IMO and FMI. The project produces atmospheric reanalysis for the European part of the Arctic regions for the period of May 1997 to Apr 2021 with 3-hour interval. CARRA reanalysis is performed on two model domains, CARRA_SW with a gridmesh of 1280x1080x65  and CARRA_NE, a gridmesh of 1000x800x65, corresponding to the operational weather forecasting domains at DMI-IMO (IGB) and met.no AROME_arctic. The grid resolution is 2.5 km, with model top at ca 10 hpa.

See [https://climate.copernicus.eu/copernicus-arctic-regional-reanalysis-service general information about the project on the C3S website].

CARRA is now at production phase. The progress of the project can be followed through [https://hirlam.org/portal/oprint/WebgraF/CARRA/Prod/index.html?choice_ind=0  the CARRA monitoring interface ], which provide information about daily throughput, time series of observation usage, verification against observations  inter-compared with ERA-5, operational met.no and DMI-IMO forecast for overlapped periods. [https://hirlam.org/portal/CARRA/Progress/current_state_sims.html Estimation about CARRA production delivery] is updated every day based on delivery speed of the past 30 days. Monitoring of [https://shiny.hirlam.org/obsCARRA observation usage] in CARRA production and working page for [https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1TJyNF8KPK4sdJXYpGca2jXuv2WbIV1U- CARRA production team] are presented.

Project C3S 322 Lot2 consists of 5 work packages. The project coordinator is Harald Schyberg, met.no, with support of 4 principle investigators leading the work packages. 

== WP0: Management and implementation (lead: Harald Schyberg, MET Norway) ==

== WP1: System development (lead: Xiaohua Yang, DMI) ==
 1. CARRA assimilation setup (Jelena Bojarova, SMHI)
  * Inclusion of large scale information
  * Uncertainty estimation method
  * Background error statistics and interpolation 
 1. CARRA System configuration, testing and verification (Morten Køltzow, MET Norway)
  * [wiki:CARRA/CARRA_system  CARRA system] repository development
  * [wiki:CARRA/validation_about_40h1.2 CARRA validation] 
  * Full CARRA system documentation
 1. Development of monitoring system (Eivind Støylen, MET Norway)
 1. Proof of concept Pan-arctic reanalysis system (NN, MET Norway)
== WP2: Input Data and Corresponding Code / Handling (lead: Heiner Körnich, SMHI) ==
 1. Surface: PGD data (Kristian Pagh Nielsen, DMI)
 1. Surface: Glacier input and albedo (Kristian Pagh Nielsen, DMI)
 1. Surface: SST and Sea ice  (Jacob Høyer, DMI)
 1. Surface: Snow input (Mariken Homleid, MET Norway)  
 1. Surface analysis: Moisture and temperature input (Heiner Körnich, SMHI)
 1. Upper air analysis: Conventional observations (Magnus Lindskog, SMHI)  
 1. Upper air analysis: Microwave radiance (Roger Randriamampianina, MET Norway)
 1. Upper air analysis: Infrarad radiance (Roger Randriamampianina, MET Norway)
 1. Upper air analysis: AMV, Scatterometer and RO (Roger Randriamampianina, MET Norway)

= Rules for external presentations and publications on the project =

We are strongly discouraged by ECMWF to use an acronym (CARRA) for our project when presenting it externally. This is because they are concerned it might prevent the "branding" of the ''Copernicus'' name. For external presentations we can for instance write out ''Copernicus Arctic Regional Reanalysis'' instead of using ''CARRA''. We are still free to use ''CARRA'' internally or to use it as a name for the dataset or for the code branch.

Our agreement with ECMWF says that we are not allowed to make any "press announcements or publicity" about the project without prior consent from ECMWF. For scientific presentations/publications we should inform ECMWF through the CARRA project coordinator (Harald), and all publications should acknowledge Copernicus and ECMWF with the following statement: ''"This work has been funded by the Copernicus Climate Change Service. ECMWF implements this Service on behalf of the European Commission."'' Presentations and posters should use the templates provided below.

= Evolution and status of CARRA reanalysis system, List of experiments =

On Oct 8 2019, CARRA.1 is tagged, which is the final, official CARRA reanalysis system, version 1.

On March 22 2019, CARRA-rc.2 is tagged, which is the system release candidate version 2 toward the final CARRA system.

On March 8 2019, CARRA-rc.1 is tagged, which is the system release candidate for the final CARRA system.

On Dec 23 2018, CARRA-beta.2 is tagged, which is targeted as a new system baselines for evaluation prior to tagging of release candidates for final CARRA system.

On Oct 25 2018, CARRA-beta.1 is tagged, which serves as an updated meteorological baselines for CARRA evaluation and validation. Beta.1 contains most of the targeted system developments.

On July 4 2018, CARRA-alpha.2 is tagged, which serves as technical baselines for series of evaluation and validation scheduled for development of individual components.

Following tables summaries validation runs about the released version and sensitivity/impact study in connection with tests with code basis on alpha.2 and beta.1. Links to short description of results should be provided when ready. (See also [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IeIZtEjelGRCqrr8KQKtS7iNdCgf9JZcaKfv6MN4s4U CARRA system configuration plan].) If no periods have been suggested otherwise, we propose to use the two previously suggested testing periods of January 2000 and January 2017. However, for some components longer periods/other periods/different seasons are needed, so experiment periods could be chosen differently. Following dates for test periods are tentative and up for iterations.

=== Monitoring of CARRA production suites ===

* [https://hirlam.org/portal/oprint/WebgraF/CARRA/Prod/index.html?choice_ind=0  CARRA monitoring portal] provides information about 
 * daily throughput, time series of observation usage, verification against ERA-5 and observations
 * [https://shiny.hirlam.org/obsCARRA monitoring of observation usage] 
* [https://hirlam.org/portal/CARRA/Progress/current_state_sims.html Estimation about CARRA production delivery], updated every day based on delivery speed during the past 7 days
* [https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1TJyNF8KPK4sdJXYpGca2jXuv2WbIV1U- Working page for CARRA production team] 

= Launch CARRA experiment =

On Oct 8 2019, carra.1 was tagged. 
For setting up experiments and launching month long tests, using following type of launching command,
{{{
~hlam/Harmonie setup -r ~nhx/CARRA_repository/carra.1
~hlam/Harmonie co St
./St 1999122000 2000013121
}}}

= Other background material =

Poster (from ICR 5, 2017 in Rome) from Horanyi et al, ECMWF, on reanalysis monitoring: [https://hirlam.org/trac/attachment/wiki/CARRA%20Reanalysis/ERA5Monitoring-AO_final.pdf pdf] and [https://hirlam.org/trac/attachment/wiki/CARRA%20Reanalysis/ERA5Monitoring-AO_final.pptx pptx (also serves as poster template)].
\\
Overview and background information from Andras Horanyi on ERA5 monitoring tools (February 2018): 
[https://hirlam.org/trac/attachment/wiki/CARRA%20Reanalysis/monitoring_and_behind.pdf monitoring_and_behind.pdf]
